definition: to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss

sentences.english: The nation was led astray by a mountebank.
sentences.chinese: 這個國家被一個誇誇其談的騙子引入歧途。

sentences.english: It is literary gas and gaiters.
sentences.chinese: 這完全是文學上的誇誇其談。

sentences.english: Not listening to an interviewee whom you've decided is a rambler, etc.
sentences.chinese: 你認定其是個誇誇其談的人，所以就不聽了，等等。

sentences.english: So there goes my emo rant about shadow priests.
sentences.chinese: 這就是我關於暗牧的感情化的誇誇其談。

sentences.english: Sentiment and eloquence serve only to impede the pursuit of truth.
sentences.chinese: 感情用事和誇誇其談只能阻礙對真理的追求。

sentences.english: I remember Jackson was more declamatory, in the Racine manner.
sentences.chinese: 我記得傑克遜更誇誇其談，在拉辛的方式。

sentences.english: ThereThey were full of wind or full of hot air.
sentences.chinese: 他們滿是風或者熱氣，誇誇其談。

sentences.english: He blew a lot of hot air about health and nutrition.
sentences.chinese: 他誇誇其談地說了好多關於健康和營養的事。

sentences.english: He sounds even more bombastic in this life than the previous existence.
sentences.chinese: 相比前生，他聽起來在此生更爲誇誇其談。

sentences.english: His speech was full of bombast.
sentences.chinese: 他的講演通篇是誇誇其談。

sentences.english: So let us not talk falsely now, the hour is getting late.
sentences.chinese: 所以我們別誇誇其談了，時辰已經不早。

sentences.english: He is a gassy man. I don't like him.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個誇誇其談的人，我不喜歡他。

sentences.english: Do we really have to sit and listen to his mindless ranting all evening?
sentences.chinese: 我們真的得整晚坐着聽他那愚蠢的誇誇其談嗎？

sentences.english: What he said was just rant . Don't take it seriously.
sentences.chinese: 他所說的是誇誇其談，不要當真。

sentences.english: Tom's increase in importance did not lead him to make bombastic speeches at the party.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆的榮升並未導致他在聚會上誇誇其談。

sentences.english: Can you make out the significance of the gassy speech which he harangued ?
sentences.chinese: 你能理解他那長篇大論誇誇其談的講話的意義嗎？

definition: scholars tend to disparage one another (idiom)
lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head)/I don't understand a word (idiom)/it's all Greek to me
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
mouth like a torrent (idiom)/eloquent/glib/voluble/have the gift of the gab
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
